Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; edges and underside, and the inside of the vessel glazed black. Swan to left, its wings raised. In the field two incised rosettes and one blob rosette; added red on the wing-bow.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 78, no. 259 pl. 59)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0945)
